wikipedia_page.main: Ernest C. Warde (10 August 1874 – 9 September 1923) was an English actor and director who worked in American silent film. He contributed to more than forty films from 1914 to 1923. He was the son of stage actor Frederick Warde.

link_mentions.page: The Man Without a Country (1917 film)
response: The Man Without a Country is a 1917 American silent film adaptation of Edward Everett Hale's short story The Man Without a Country. It was directed by Ernest C. Warde, and starred Florence La Badie, Holmes Herbert, and J. H. Gilmour, and released by Thanhouser Film Corporation.The American Film Institute Catalog Feature Films: 1911-20 published by The American Film Institute, c.1988

The play was adapted into a number of film adaptations; an Australian film in 1911 directed by W. J. Lincoln,Mary Bateman, 'W. J. Lincoln', Cinema Papers, June–July 1980 p 174 a 1913 American film directed by Oscar Apfel, a 1918 American film The Bells (1918 film) directed by Ernest C. Warde, a 1925 British-Belgian film (aka Le juif polonais) directed by Harry Southwell,Workman, Christopher; Howarth, Troy (2016). "Tome of Terror: Horror Films of the Silent Era". Midnight Marquee Press. p. 283.  . the 1926 Hollywood film starring Lionel Barrymore and Boris Karloff, and a British film in 1931 which starred Donald Caltrop as Mathias. Harry Southwell remade the film again later in Australia as The Burgomeister (1935).
*a 1918 American film directed by Ernest C. Wardehttp://www.silentera.com/PSFL/data/B/Bells1918.html
| Ruth of the Range || Ernest C. Warde || Ruth Roland, Bruce Gordon, Lorimer Johnston || A serial comprising 15 episodes. ||

The Woman in White is a 1917 American drama film directed by Ernest C. Warde and starring Florence La Badie, Richard R. Neill, and Gertrude Dallas.Progressive Silent Film List: The Woman in White at silentera.com It comprises five reels of 4,627 feet and had its premiere on July 1, 1917. Length: 1 hour 8 minutes. The film was originally distributed by Pathé. In the 1920s it was re-released under the title The Unfortunate Marriage.
*Directed by Ernest C. Warde
A Newspaper Nemesis is a 1915 American short silent drama film, directed by Jack Harvey. It stars Peggy Burke, Mrs. Samuel Sullivan, and Ernest C. Warde.
The White Rose is a 1914 American short silent drama film, directed by Jack Harvey for the Thanhouser Company. It stars Boyd Marshall, Muriel Ostriche, and Ernest C. Warde.
The Skinflint is a 1915 American short silent drama film, directed by Jack Harvey for the Thanhouser Company. It stars Ernest C. Warde, David Thompson, Carey L. Hastings.
The Undertow  is a 1915 American short silent drama film, directed by Jack Harvey for the Thanhouser Company. It stars Ethel Jewett, Ernest C. Warde, and Bert Delaney.

King Lear is a 1916 silent film based on the 1606 play, directed by Ernest C. Warde and starring his father, the noted stage actor Frederick Warde. The film is one of a spate of Shakespearean films produced at the time to coincide with the 300th anniversary celebrations of William Shakespeare's death.
* Ernest C. Warde as Gillen Jolyon

The False Code is a lost 1919 American silent drama film directed by Ernest C. Warde and produced by and starring Frank Keenan. It was distributed by Pathé Exchange.The AFI Catalog of Feature Films 1893-1993: The False Code

The Master Man is a 1919 silent film drama directed by Ernest C. Warde and produced by and starring Frank Keenan. It was distributed by Pathé Exchange films.The AFI Catalog of Feature Films 1893-1993:The Master Man

The Midnight Stage is a 1919 silent film western directed by Ernest C. Warde and starring Frank Keenan. It was distributed by the Pathé Exchange company.The AFI Catalog of Feature Films 1893–1993:The Midnight Stage
* Ernest C. Warde – 'Rat' McGrough
Category:Films directed by Ernest C. Warde

Ruler of the Road is a 1918 silent film drama directed by Ernest C. Warde and starring Frank Keenan. It was produced and released by the Pathé Exchange company.The AFI Catalog of Feature Films 1893-1993: "Ruler of the Road"

The Vicar of Wakefield is a 1917 American silent historical drama film directed by Ernest C. Warde and starring Frederick Warde, Boyd Marshall and Kathryn Adams. It is based on the 1766 novel The Vicar of Wakefield by Oliver Goldsmith. Unlike many productions of the era, the film still survives.Ward p.32
Category:Films directed by Ernest C. Warde
The Joyous Liar is a 1919 American silent comedy film directed by Ernest C. Warde and starring J. Warren Kerrigan, Lillian Walker, and Joseph J. Dowling.Flowers & Frizler p.314

Silas Marner is a 1916 American silent drama film directed by Ernest C. Warde and starring Frederick Warde, Valda Valkyrien, and Morgan Jones. It is an adaptation of the 1861 novel Silas Marner by George Eliot.Goble p. 145
